notes: First generation Diamond-Star Motors sport coupe built in Normal, Illinois. Platform-shared with Eagle Talon and Plymouth Laser. GSX trim featured turbocharged 4G63 engine with AWD. Timing belt maintenance critical on all engines. AWD models require additional complexity for drivetrain service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Eclipse article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Second generation with new rounded styling. Built in Normal, Illinois. Spyder convertible introduced 1996. GSX retained turbocharged 4G63 engine with AWD. Timing belt maintenance required on all engines. Last Eclipse generation with AWD option. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Eclipse article, January 17, 2025 revision.

High-performance grand tourer (GTO in Japan). VR-4 trim featured twin-turbocharged 6G72 engine, AWD, active aerodynamics, four-wheel steering, and electronically controlled suspension. Complex timing belt service with interference engine. VR-4 requires specialized diagnostic equipment for advanced systems. Premium fuel required for turbo variants. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi GTO article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Revised styling and increased power for VR-4. 6-speed manual transmission available on 1999 VR-4. Complex timing belt service required. Active aerodynamics and four-wheel steering on VR-4. Discontinued after 1999 in North America. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi GTO article, January 17, 2025 revision.
Sixth generation midsize sedan. Timing belt maintenance required. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Galant article, January 17, 2025 revision.
Seventh generation midsize sedan. Timing belt maintenance required on both engines. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Galant article, January 17, 2025 revision.
First generation full-size luxury sedan. Timing belt maintenance required. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Diamante article, January 17, 2025 revision.
Second generation with increased displacement. Timing belt maintenance required. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Diamante article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Second generation full-size SUV (Pajero internationally). Super Select 4WD system. Timing belt maintenance required. Known for Consumer Reports rollover concerns in 1996. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Pajero article, January 17, 2025 revision.
Midsize SUV based on Triton/L200 pickup platform. Timing belt maintenance required on all engines. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Challenger article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Compact pickup truck (L200/Triton internationally). Timing belt maintenance required on both engines. Discontinued in North America after 1996 model year. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Triton article, January 17, 2025 revision.
Fifth generation subcompact. Coupe variant available through 1996. Timing belt maintenance required. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Mirage article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Compact MPV/wagon (RVR in Japan). AWD available on certain trims. Timing belt maintenance required. Short North American run. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi RVR article, January 17, 2025 revision.
